trans-unit.source: Introduction to App Service Environment
trans-unit.target: Introduction to App Service Environment

trans-unit.source: Learn about the App Service Environment feature that provides secure, VNet-joined, dedicated scale units for running all of your apps.
trans-unit.target: Learn about the App Service Environment feature that provides secure, VNet-joined, dedicated scale units for running all of your apps.

trans-unit.source: An App Service Environment is a <linkText>Premium[premiumtier]</linkText><title></title> service plan option of Azure App Service that provides a fully isolated and dedicated environment for securely running all of your apps.
trans-unit.target: An App Service Environment is a <linkText>Premium[premiumtier]</linkText><title></title> service plan option of Azure App Service that provides a fully isolated and dedicated environment for securely running all of your apps.

trans-unit.source: This includes <linkText>Web Apps[webapps]</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Mobile Apps[mobileapps]</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>API Apps[apiapps]</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Logic Apps[logicapps]</linkText><title></title> with expanded scaling options.
trans-unit.target: This includes <linkText>Web Apps[webapps]</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Mobile Apps[mobileapps]</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>API Apps[apiapps]</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Logic Apps[logicapps]</linkText><title></title> with expanded scaling options.

trans-unit.source: Compute resources for an App Service Environment are exclusively dedicated to running only your apps.
trans-unit.target: Compute resources for an App Service Environment are exclusively dedicated to running only your apps.

trans-unit.source: An App Service Environment is always created in a regional virtual network, which gives your apps new options for network isolation.
trans-unit.target: An App Service Environment is always created in a regional virtual network, which gives your apps new options for network isolation.

trans-unit.source: Furthermore an App Service Environment supports additional scaling options, with up to fifty (50) compute resources available to run your apps.
trans-unit.target: Furthermore an App Service Environment supports additional scaling options, with up to fifty (50) compute resources available to run your apps.

trans-unit.source: Outside of an App Service Environment there is a limit of 20 compute resources to host your apps.
trans-unit.target: Outside of an App Service Environment there is a limit of 20 compute resources to host your apps.

trans-unit.source: An App Service Environment can either be created in a pre-existing regional virtual network, or a new regional virtual network (<linkText>more info on virtual networks[moreinfoonvirtualnetworks]</linkText><title></title>).
trans-unit.target: An App Service Environment can either be created in a pre-existing regional virtual network, or a new regional virtual network (<linkText>more info on virtual networks[moreinfoonvirtualnetworks]</linkText><title></title>).

trans-unit.source: Since an App Service Environment always exists in a regional virtual network, and more precisely within a subnet of a regional virtual network, you can leverage the security features of virtual networks to control both inbound and outbound network communications.
trans-unit.target: Since an App Service Environment always exists in a regional virtual network, and more precisely within a subnet of a regional virtual network, you can leverage the security features of virtual networks to control both inbound and outbound network communications.

trans-unit.source: You can use <linkText>network security groups[networksecuritygroups]</linkText><title></title> to restrict inbound network communications to the subnet where an App Service Environment resides.
trans-unit.target: You can use <linkText>network security groups[networksecuritygroups]</linkText><title></title> to restrict inbound network communications to the subnet where an App Service Environment resides.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to run apps behind upstream devices and services such as web application firewalls, and network SaaS providers.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to run apps behind upstream devices and services such as web application firewalls, and network SaaS providers.

trans-unit.source: Apps also frequently need to access corporate resources such as internal databases and web services.
trans-unit.target: Apps also frequently need to access corporate resources such as internal databases and web services.

trans-unit.source: A common approach is to make these endpoints available only to internal network traffic flowing within an Azure virtual network.
trans-unit.target: A common approach is to make these endpoints available only to internal network traffic flowing within an Azure virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Once an App Service Environment is joined to the same virtual network as the internal services, apps running in the environment can access them, including endpoints reachable via <linkText>Site-to-Site[sitetosite]</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Azure ExpressRoute[expressroute]</linkText><title></title> connections.
trans-unit.target: Once an App Service Environment is joined to the same virtual network as the internal services, apps running in the environment can access them, including endpoints reachable via <linkText>Site-to-Site[sitetosite]</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Azure ExpressRoute[expressroute]</linkText><title></title> connections.

trans-unit.source: All of the compute resources in an App Service Environment are dedicated exclusively to a single subscription.
trans-unit.target: All of the compute resources in an App Service Environment are dedicated exclusively to a single subscription.

trans-unit.source: An App Service Environment is composed of a single front-end compute resource pool, as well as one to three worker compute resource pools.
trans-unit.target: An App Service Environment is composed of a single front-end compute resource pool, as well as one to three worker compute resource pools.

trans-unit.source: The front-end pool contains compute resources responsible for SSL termination as well automatic load balancing of app requests within an App Service Environment.
trans-unit.target: The front-end pool contains compute resources responsible for SSL termination as well automatic load balancing of app requests within an App Service Environment.

trans-unit.source: Each worker pool contains compute resources allocated to <linkText>App Service Plans[appserviceplan]</linkText><title></title>, which in turn contain one or more Azure App Service apps.
trans-unit.target: Each worker pool contains compute resources allocated to <linkText>App Service Plans[appserviceplan]</linkText><title></title>, which in turn contain one or more Azure App Service apps.

trans-unit.source: Since there can be up to three different worker pools in an App Service Environment, you have the flexibility to choose different compute resources for each worker pool.
trans-unit.target: Since there can be up to three different worker pools in an App Service Environment, you have the flexibility to choose different compute resources for each worker pool.

trans-unit.source: For example this allows you to create one worker pool with less powerful compute resources for App Service Plans intended for development or test apps.
trans-unit.target: For example this allows you to create one worker pool with less powerful compute resources for App Service Plans intended for development or test apps.

trans-unit.source: A second (or even third) worker pool could use more powerful compute resources intended for App Service Plans running production apps.
trans-unit.target: A second (or even third) worker pool could use more powerful compute resources intended for App Service Plans running production apps.

trans-unit.source: An App Service Environment can be configured with up to fifty (50) compute resources in a single worker pool.
trans-unit.target: An App Service Environment can be configured with up to fifty (50) compute resources in a single worker pool.

trans-unit.source: For more details on the quantity of compute resources available to the front-end and worker pools, see <linkText>How To Configure an App Service Environment[howtoconfigureanappserviceenvironment]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details on the quantity of compute resources available to the front-end and worker pools, see <linkText>How To Configure an App Service Environment[howtoconfigureanappserviceenvironment]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For details on the available compute resource sizes supported in an App Service Environment, consult the <linkText>App Service Pricing[appservicepricing]</linkText><title></title> page and review the available options for App Service Environments in the Premium pricing tier.
trans-unit.target: For details on the available compute resource sizes supported in an App Service Environment, consult the <linkText>App Service Pricing[appservicepricing]</linkText><title></title> page and review the available options for App Service Environments in the Premium pricing tier.

trans-unit.source: To get started with App Service Environments, see <linkText>How To Create An App Service Environment[howtocreateanappserviceenvironment]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: To get started with App Service Environments, see <linkText>How To Create An App Service Environment[howtocreateanappserviceenvironment]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Azure App Service platform, see <linkText>Azure App Service[azureappservice]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Azure App Service platform, see <linkText>Azure App Service[azureappservice]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For an overview of the App Service Environment network architecture, see the <linkText>Network Architecture Overview[networkarchitectureoverview]</linkText><title></title> article.
trans-unit.target: For an overview of the App Service Environment network architecture, see the <linkText>Network Architecture Overview[networkarchitectureoverview]</linkText><title></title> article.

trans-unit.source: For details on using an App Service Environment with ExpressRoute, see the following article on <linkText>Express Route and App Service Environments[networkconfigdetailsforexpressroute]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For details on using an App Service Environment with ExpressRoute, see the following article on <linkText>Express Route and App Service Environments[networkconfigdetailsforexpressroute]</linkText><title></title>.
